issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: EBS backed instances disappear if backing volume fails during creation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

After launching an EBS-backed instance, the instance no longer shows in the output of 'euca-describe-instances'.  
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-BEB9C71A --block-device-mapping "/dev/sdf=:30" --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-F5BE5CFE	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-0A2DEB5A	emi-BEB9C71A			pending	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T15:56:52.650Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-0A2DEB5A --region account1-user01@
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
{code}
What I noticed is that the CC/SC go into 'DISABLED' state:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	user-api          	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe           	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/User-API	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:user-api:SheHatesMe/
SERVICE	autoscaling       	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.autoscaling	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:autoscaling:SheHatesMe.autoscaling/
SERVICE	cloudwatch        	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.cloudwatch	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:cloudwatch:SheHatesMe.cloudwatch/
SERVICE	compute           	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.compute   	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:compute:SheHatesMe.compute/
SERVICE	euare             	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.euare     	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Euare	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:euare:SheHatesMe.euare/
SERVICE	loadbalancing     	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.loadbalancing	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:loadbalancing:SheHatesMe.loadbalancing/
SERVICE	objectstorage     	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.objectstorage	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:objectstorage:SheHatesMe.objectstorage/
SERVICE	tokens            	SheHatesMe	SheHatesMe.tokens    	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.11:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:SheHatesMe:tokens:SheHatesMe.tokens/

SERVICE	compute           	ShoesForRunning	ShoesForRunning.compute	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.1.218:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:ShoesForRunning:compute:ShoesForRunning.compute/

SERVICE	autoscalingbackend	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscalingbackend:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	dns               	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Dns	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	imaging           	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:eucalyptus::imaging:10.104.10.55/
SERVICE	notifications     	eucalyptus	10.104.10.55         	ENABLED 	49  	http://10.104.10.55:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.10.55/

{code}
They do come back to ENABLED state while dd is running on the CC/SC machine, but the instance still does not show up:
{code}

## CC/SC ##
[root@odc-d-31 ~]# ps aux | grep dd
root         2  0.0  0.0      0     0 ?        S    May19   0:00 [kthreadd]
root      1402  0.0  0.0  22444   536 ?        S    May19   0:00 hald-addon-input: Listening on /dev/input/event0
68        1424  0.0  0.0  17932   552 ?        S    May19   0:00 hald-addon-acpi: listening on acpid socket /var/run/acpid.socket
root     24283  8.3  0.0 106216  1684 ?        D    09:00   0:02 dd if=//var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/snap-785DCD44 of=/dev/euca-ebs-storage-vg-vol-F572A2F7/euca-vol-F572A2F7 bs=1M
root     25156  0.0  0.0 103256   836 pts/0    S+   09:00   0:00 grep dd
{code}
Additionally, the volume gets created for the EBS-backed instance, but its not associated to any instance:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-volumes --region account1-user01@
VOLUME	vol-F572A2F7	10	snap-785DCD44	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	available	2014-06-16T15:56:52.865Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-40EA7AD9	30		ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	available	2014-06-16T15:56:52.745Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-D17E9A0A	3		ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	available	2014-06-10T00:48:36.193Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-D4477151	3		ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	available	2014-06-10T14:40:37.952Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-4D2C66D5	10		ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors	available	2014-06-16T14:10:43.424Z	standard

[root@odc-f-13 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-BEB9C71A --region account1-user01@
IMAGE	emi-BEB9C71A	408396244283/trusty-server-ebs-crypted	408396244283	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda	snap-785DCD44	10	true
{code}

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.0 cloud
** Eucalyptus DNS enabled
** with multiple UFS
** managed networking mode
** topology
*** 1 x CLC
*** 1 x UFS
*** 1 x UFS, Walrus
*** 1 x CC/SC (overlay)
**** CC is gateway for NCs
*** 2 x NC
# Create EBS-backed EMI with 10 gig EBS volume.  Steps can be referenced from [the KB article regarding creating an EBS-backed EMI|https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/201605884-Creating-an-Ubuntu-EBS-backed-EMI-from-an-Existing-Instance-Store-Backed-Instance].
# After the EBS-backed EMI has been created, launch it with block device mapping option.  For example:
{code}
# euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-BEB9C71A --block-device-mapping "/dev/sdf=:30" --region account1-user01@
RESERVATION	r-F5BE5CFE	408396244283	default
INSTANCE	i-0A2DEB5A	emi-BEB9C71A			pending	account1-user01	0		m1.medium	2014-06-16T15:56:52.650Z	ViciousLiesAndDangerousRumors				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs					hvm			sg-A5133B59
{code}
# Run euca-describe-instances and observe the instance not showing up in the list:
{code}
# euca-describe-instances i-0A2DEB5A --region account1-user01@
[root@odc-f-13 ~]#
{code}

*Signs*

* Errors in the cloud-debug.log on the CLC:
{code}
# grep i-0A2DEB5A /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log*

fields.summary: EBS-backed Instance Lost After Being Launched
fields.environment:
* 1 x CLC
* 1 x UFS
* 1 x UFS, Walrus
* 1 x CC/SC (Overlay)
** CC is gateway for NCs
* 2 x NCs
* Managed mode

comments.body: attached [sosreport for UFS involved with EC2 API requests|https://s3.amazonaws.com/euca-9559/sosreport-UFS-c-11.9559-20140616094958-1db9.tar.xz]
Dropping this to 'major' severity as we have been unable to reproduce it in any test runs and normal usage. If we see it appear in the 4.1.0 code during testing we will elevate it in severity.
Dropping to minor as we have not seen it in QA or in manual testing. I will close it soon if we cannot reproduce it in 4.1.0 code.
